class.name: CFFIScope
class.brief_description: CFFI type scopes, so that different libraries can have distinct struct definitions with the same name.

method.name: create_function
method.description: Create a new native function from a [Callable] and the function's prototype. This way you can pass Callables to native code as function pointers. You are responsible for keeping the [CFFICallableFunction] alive while native code has access to it. You are responsible for passing the correct return type and array of argument types. Types may be either [CFFIType] or a String, for example [code]"int"[/code] or [code]"const char *"[/code]. If [param callable] or any of the passed types are not valid, [code]null[/code] is returned and an error printed.

method.name: define_struct
method.description: Defines a new struct type. [param name] cannot have any pointer levels. If a struct with the same name is found in this scope, [code]null[/code] is returned and an error printed.

method.name: find_type
method.description: Finds a type by [param name]. If the base type name cannot be found in this scope, the global scope (the [CFFI] singleton) is searched. Pointers and CV qualifiers are supported. This method is called when accessing properties by name, so that [code]some_cffi_scope["int"][/code] returns the CFFIType for [code]int[/code].
